comment: Shes super passionate about her classes and material, however to most it is extremely boring. Shes average on difficulty, I made a B but put in no effort. I can imagine if someone where to put in effort they would receive an A. I regret not striving harder for the A!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough Grader--Caring

comment: Professor Sosower is one of the best professors I have ever had. She created a structures class that also allowed for us to breathe creatively. In her class I was allowed to dive into projects that made me think as an artist instead of just following rules. I wish she was a full time teacher so I could take more classes with her!

Prof Sosower was one of my favorite professors. Her grading criteria is clear but leaves room for taking artistic liberties. She is open to discussing grades and giving feedback, in class or outside of class. Very accessible, always answered emails quickly. A good amount of homework, but it's an art class so nothing out of the ordinary for that
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Really cool professor and class! I didn't think I would enjoy it but she made the material interesting, timely, and fun. She wants you to pass and will try her hardest to help you but you still need to try. One major project with smaller quizzes every 3 or so weeks but the project is the biggest grade. Talk to her after class, youll like her a lot

She is very sweet and wants you to pass. There is one major project, so Do your work and you will pass. But if you miss a deadline do not sweat it, she hands out a bunch of extra credit! With her grading system it is easy to tell how much you have at the end, I ended up with almost 30 points of extra credit and her grade scale goes up to 300.

She makes me wish I was an art major or something. Prof. Sosower is so passionate about what she does and she makes the class fun. It's very interactive. Just do your work(which isn't even a lot), and you'll pass. She's so nice and lively and she replies to emails super quick! TAKE HER CLASSSS!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She's a nice person but the workload was too much for me to juggle. Only take this class if your devoted to art and an art major because her class was too fast to keep up with. She gave us way too much for a class filled mostly without art majors. Otherwise, her online quizzes aren't too hard. She gave extra credit for showing up to most classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I liked the professor as a person, but she gives way too much work for the class. Multiple projects, papers, and quizzes that are time consuming.
Very interesting and knowledgeable. She is very friendly and open. Attendance matters throughout the semester, she gives extra credit for coming!!!

This class is not an easy A, but its fair. You have to do one museum visit and a big art archive project and a presentation. There are 6 quizzes that follow the PPTs. There are 4 hw assignments that require some time. The final is cumulative but she reviews the whole thing day before final. Keep up with the deadlines and you'll be good.
She was awesome and fun. The class is interesting it made me enjoy art and want to learn more about premodern world history. Take this class! I got a high A.

One of my favorite professors so far at KSU! While the material can be boring at times, she makes it enjoyable. She offers extra credit opportunities throughout the semester and each of them allow you to explore art in a different way. No tests besides the final. There are a bunch of quizzes and they are all via powerpoint/timed but super easy.

Boring lecture class with a ton of written assignments. However, the assignments are graded pretty leiniently. 8 quizzes that require some studying and final questions come straight from quizzes. Ton of extra credit, so if you put in the effort you will be able to make an A without too much effort

Loved this class! Professor Sosower was one of my favorite professors at Kennesaw. She is truly passionate about art and it shows in her class. Art appreciation was more work than I anticipated but with effort an A is totally achievable. Tests aren't too bad if you study and she sometimes offers extra credit for showing up to class. Take her!!
Great Professor, boring class. She does what she can to make it enjoyable, but the assignments themselves drag on forever.

She's quirky  and funny. It was a lot more work than I expected from an Art Appreciation class, but I enjoyed the topics and her lectures. You need to read the book to pass with flying colors, but if you attend class everyday you can get extra credit and sometimes a question-for-question study guide for the tests.

Ms. Deb was really there for me. I was going through so much this semester and she was so empathetic towards my situation and she really pushed me. Being in her class has taught me so much! Her instructions were quite unclear at times but you can ALWAYS ask he for clarity and she will help you!  Thank you Ms. Deb for such a wonderful semester! 3

I took her this past semester and missed a few classes. Everytime I asked for help catching up the overload of work she gave was way to unreasonable to get done in a short amount of time. I had doctors note's and was registered with disabilities and she barely worked with me.

Amazing prof, to the point that I'm a little sad about not continuing in art. Projects are left vague for your interpretation, but she absolutely tries to clear up any confusion. Definitely take her if you get the chance. Critiques will not trample your confidence, and she's a super positive person. Definitely has some interesting ways of teaching.

This is my 2nd time taking a class from this professor. She's always amazing and funny. The exam questions are on the projector screen and timed, but showing one question at a time, so if you missed a question, you got to wait for your question to come up again. Make sure to study her ppts! She also introduce projects early, so don't procrastinate!

Awesome professor, really helpful. If you ask too many questions though her explanations will end up leaving you more confused because she tends to overcompensate with words. Otherwise very understanding and thoughtful, especially when it comes to grading.

This was a good class, but two things really bothered me. She is not clear about what will be on the test and assigns extra credit that requires free time on the weekends Any of the extra credit I could do from home was worth only a few points while volunteering at an event that was 40 miles away was worth 20+. Not a commuter or job friendly class.

she is honestly a cool teacher. attendance is mandatory but she never checks but there are lots of extra credit opportunities. Lots of powerpoint lectures. 4 tests, 1 presentation, 1 museum visit, and a few easy homework grades.
I really enjoyed her 2D course fall 2014.  She's smart, funny, and attractive, and she truly believes in her students' ability to succeed.

Professor Sosower is a great teacher, knows what she's talking about, and loves what she does. She doesn't give any tests. she incorporates vocabulary and concepts into the lectures and homework assignments, so that you actually learn it. She is hilarious and fun. Often her assignments are confusing, so just ask her and she will clear things up.

She really gives you a whole new perspective on the basic principles of art. I had fun in her class. Her assignments are slightly hard to understand, but she does that on purpose. She is really entertaining and very approachable and she tries to keep the assignments fun. You won't be disappointed when you take her class.

Sosower is an incredibly knowledgable, vivacious, encouraging professor, she makes even the basics of 2D design seem interesting, and that's a feat! She's also hilarious. The way she lectures and presents our next project really made me think and rediscover art in ways of never done before. She woke me up! I intend to take a class from her again!

She is awesome! If you get the chance to take her, do it! She is very helpful and extremely hilarious! As long as you participate, she doesn't give tests or exams. She makes class fun and interesting so your not just sitting there the whole time. I highly recommend her! You'll love it!
